const UINT8 HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  count
)  [static]
 

Adds the specified data to the end of the existing file.

Parameters:

buffer Pointer to the buffer where to copy data from.
count Number of bytes to copy.
Returns:
Success of operation.

Changes the current working directory.

Parameters:

Returns:
Success of operation.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::Close (  FatHandle  hp  )  [static]
 

Closes the file with the specified handle. Only possible if the file exists and is in open state. Saves buffered data if the file was opened for write/append operations.

Parameters:
hp File handle.
Returns:
Success of operation.

FatHandle FatHandler::Create (  const CHAR *  file_name,
UINT32  size
)  [static]
 

Creates a new empty file with file_name of the specified initial size. The file is opened for write and read operations.

Parameters:
file_name The name of the file to create.
size The initial size of the file to create.
Returns:
Valid handle of the new file on success or the invalid handle (-1) on failure.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::Delete (  const CHAR *  file_name  )  [static]
 

Deletes the file with file_name. The file should not be open when the delete operation is requested.

Parameters:
file_name The name of the file to be deleted.
Returns:
Success of operation.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::FileExists (  const CHAR *  file_name  )  [static]
 

Checks for the presence of the file with the specified file_name.

Parameters:
file_name The name of the file.
Returns:
TRUE if the file exists, FALSE otherwise.

void FatHandler::FindDone (  FatFindData &  find_data  )  [static]
 

Must be called to finish the current file find process.

Parameters:
find_data Find info record where to store data.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::FindFirst (  FatFindData &  find_data,
const CHAR *  filespec
)  [static]
 

Retrieves info on the first stored file that matches the filespec via find_data.

Parameters:
filespec Target file specification (may include the wildcards '?*').
find_data Find info record where to store data.
Returns:
TRUE if file is found, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::FindNext (  FatFindData &  find_data  )  [static]
 

Retrieves info on the next stored file that matches the filespec from the preceding FindFirst() via find_data.

Parameters:
find_data Find info record where to store data.
Returns:
TRUE if file is found, FALSE otherwise.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::Flush (  FatHandle  hp  )  [static]
 

Flushes the file with handle hp. After this call completes, the on-disk view of the file is consistent with the in-memory view.

Returns:
Success of operation.

UINT16 &  attr
)  [static]
 

Retrieves the attribute of the file with filename.

Parameters:
filename The file name.
attr The value where to store the attribute.
Returns:
Success of operation.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::GetCurrentDir (  const CHAR *  drive_letter,
CHAR *  current_dir
)  [static]
 

Retrieves the current working directory of drive with drive letter drive_letter.

Parameters:
drive_letter Specifies the drive letter of the drive for which to retrieve the current working directory.
current_dir Buffer where to store the name of the current working directory. The size of the buffer must be at least 256 bytes.
Returns:
Success of operation.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::GetFileInfo (  const CHAR *  file_name,
FatFileInfo &  info
)  [static]
 

Retrieves the file info record (name, size, timestamp, ...) of the file with file_name via info.

Parameters:
file_name The name of the file.
info File info record where to store data.
Returns:
Success of operation.

UINT32 FatHandler::GetFreeSpaceSize (   )  [static]
 

Returns the number of available bytes free on the specified FAT device.

Returns:
The number of free bytes.

FatError FatHandler::GetLastError (   )  [static]
 

Gets the error code during last file operation.

Returns:
The error code met last time.

Tells if pathname specifies a directory.

Parameters:

Tells if pathname is a directory.

Creates a new directory.

Parameters:

FatHandle FatHandler::Open (  const CHAR *  file_name,
FatOpenMode  mode
)  [static]
 

Opens a file with the specified file_name for operations specified by mode. Only possible if the file exists and is not already open.

Parameters:
file_name The name of the file to open.
mode Specifies in which mode to open the file.
Returns:
Valid handle of the open file on success or the invalid handle (-1) on failure.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::Read (  FatHandle  hp,
UINT8 HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  count
)  [static]
 

Copies count bytes of data from the file with the specified handle hp to the buffer. Only possible if the file exists and is opened for read operations.

Parameters:
hp File handle.
buffer Pointer to the buffer where to copy data to.
count Number of bytes to copy.
Returns:
Success of operation.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::ReadStreaming (  FatHandle  hp,
UINT8 HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  count,
UINT32  bytes_read,
void *  client_arg
)  [static]
 

Copies count bytes of data from the file with the specified handle hp to the buffer. Only possible if the file exists and is opened for read operations. The synchronous operation takes place with the priority of the streaming mode, which is higher than the priority of the normal synchronous FAT operations.

Parameters:
hp File handle.
buffer Pointer to the buffer where to copy data to.
count Number of bytes to copy.
Returns:
Success of operation.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::ReadStreamingAsync (  FatHandle  hp,
UINT8 HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  count,
void(callback_func)(INT16 result, void *client_arg)  ,
void *  client_arg
)  [static]
 

Copies count bytes of data from the file with the specified handle hp to the buffer. Only possible if the file exists and is opened for read operations. The asynchronous operation takes place with the priority of the streaming mode, which is higher than the priority of the normal FAT operations. The method returns immediately and the driver signalises by calling the callback_func that the asynchronous operation ended. Wheter the buffer could be filled successfully or not can be found out by the parameters of the callback_func.

Parameters:
hp File handle.
buffer Pointer to the buffer where to copy data to.
count Number of bytes to copy.
callback_func Function, which is called by the driver, when the asynchronous operation is finished.
client_arg client arguments, which are returned in the callback function.
Returns:
Success of operation.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::RemoveDir (  const CHAR *  dir_name  )  [static]
 

Deletes the directory including all the files in it.

Parameters:
dir_name The name of the directory to be deleted.
Returns:
Success of operation.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::Rename (  const CHAR *  current_file_name,
const CHAR *  new_file_name
)  [static]
 

Renames an existing file with current_file_name to new_file_name. Not possible if the file is in the open state.

Parameters:
current_file_name Specifies the current name of the file.
new_file_name Specifies the new name of the file.
Returns:
Success of operation.

UINT32 FatHandler::Seek (  FatHandle  hp,
INT32  offset,
INT16  origin,
INT16 &  err_flag
)  [static]
 

Moves the current file position.

Parameters:
hp File handle.
offset Offset specifying the amount of bytes and the direction (positive is forward, negative is backward) where to move the current file position to.
origin Position where to apply the offset to.
err_flag Receives the error code.
Returns:
The file position after the move.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::SetAttributes (  const CHAR *  filename,
UINT16  attr
)  [static]
 

Sets the attributes of the file with filename.

Parameters:
filename The file name.
attr The attribute to set to the file.
Returns:
Success of operation.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::Truncate (  FatHandle  hp,
UINT32  new_size
)  [static]
 

Truncates the open file with handle hp to new_size. Any file blocks beyond new_size are freed and the file size is adjusted. The current file position is left at the new end of the file.

Returns:
Success of operation.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::Write (  FatHandle  hp,
const UINT8 HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  count
)  [static]
 

Copies count bytes of data from buffer to the file with the specified handle hp. Only possible if the file exists and is opened for write operations.

Parameters:
hp File handle.
buffer Pointer to the buffer where to copy data from.
count Number of bytes to copy.
Returns:
Success of operation.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::WriteStreaming (  FatHandle  hp,
const UINT8 HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  count,
void *  client_arg
)  [static]
 

Copies count bytes of data from buffer to the file with the specified handle hp. Only possible if the file exists and is opened for write operations. The synchronous operation takes place with the priority of the streaming mode, which is higher than the priority of the normal FAT operations.

Parameters:
hp File handle.
buffer Pointer to the buffer where to copy data from.
count Number of bytes to copy.
Returns:
Success of operation.

BOOLEAN FatHandler::WriteStreamingAsync (  FatHandle  hp,
const UINT8 HUGE *  buffer,
UINT32  count,
void(callback_func)(INT16 result, void *client_arg)  ,
void *  client_arg
)  [static]
 

Copies count bytes of data from buffer to the file with the specified handle hp. Only possible if the file exists and is opened for write operations. The asynchronous operation takes place with the priority of the streaming mode, which is higher than the priority of the normal FAT operations. The method returns immediately and the driver signalises by calling the callback that the asynchronous operation ended. Wheter the buffer could be filled successfully or not can be found out by the parameters of the callback_func.

Parameters:
hp File handle.
buffer Pointer to the buffer where to copy data from.
count Number of bytes to copy.
callback_func Function, which is called by the driver, when the asynchronous operation is finished.
client_arg client arguments, which are returned in the callback function.
Returns:
Success of operation.
